name: Villagio Inn and Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Right on the main road, the hotel is noisy, the rooms crowded together. It has a freeway motel feel.
reviews.title: Will not return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was so bad, the noise so discouraging, The food in the event room was rubbery and of poor quality. I left early. The pool, though warm, is small. Altogether a very bad deal for the Napa Valley which abounds with lovely places to stay.
reviews.title: WARNING!! Find another place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were celebrating our 4th wedding anniversary and decided to come to the beautiful Napa Valley. We chose Yountville because of its great location and world class food and wine. We chose the Villagio because of a high Trip Advisor score. We booked 2 nights through the hotel where the operator assured us that our room would be quiet, and that by paying more, we would also get a premium view of the hills (about $435 a night). She also directed us to view the website and see the beautiful rooms and vaulted ceilings of the top floor rooms. Imagine our surprise when the bellmen led us to our room on the edge of a major construction site! The view from ALL three sides of our room was of construction! In addition the room was just so "marginal" in its look and style. It wasn't romantic, it wasn't hip or cool and it certainly wasn't elegant. In fact it even lacked any good function or flow. We asked to be moved and were told they had no more rooms. I spoke with the manager and he offered to move us the next day. Needless to say, we were extremely disappointed that no one told us about construction when we booked the room. And that the picture of the room on the website was not our (get this) newly redecorated room. The bed was marginal, the furnishings were low-end looking although new, and the wall decor was done in an odd way. The feeling is low-end hotel that tries unsuccessfully to do Pottery Barn and fails. The next morning we were woken at 7:30 AM by construction workers hammering. By 7:45 there were numerous large dump trucks with their motors running and skill saws cutting. Don't you just love the sound of a truck backing up outside on the morning of your anniversary? It's just so romantic! I called the manager and complained about the early construction start, the loud noise, and again that we were not informed about construction when we made reservations. He offered us a free nights lodging. We declined and of course we checked out. He adjusted the bill by 50% but keep in mind this room was almost $450 to start. At $225 it was still not worth it, even without construction. Just go across the street to the Yountville Inn to get a better rate and a better room. We know because my wife has stayed there in the last year.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007
reviews.text: Even without the construction, the setting of Villagio is like that of a former low-end apartment building converted into a hotel. There is nothing special or charming about it except the reception area. No one at any time ever disagreed with us about any of our complaints.
reviews.title: Walk right in, get 5 rooms!

likes.disliked: — Construction site (but that will pass over time)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are coming to the Villagio for a company conference and used to a basic business hotel room, this is going to be fine. If you are with a budget tour group it will be fine. But if you think you are going to get a Napa Valley Spa and Resort experience, you need to go somewhere else. And, don't pay the high rates. This is not a true spa experience. Even without construction there is a great deal of noise from the highway next to the property. The rooms and the setting reflect a conversion and not an luxury master plan. There are too many good options in the valley. Don't be fooled by their advertising. It is not accurate.
reviews.title: Villagio in Yountville is great!

likes.disliked: — there was nothing we were unhappy with

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Valligio Inn through Napa Valley Bike Tours. This was a wonderful place to stay, and we are thankful that they booked it for us. When we first arrived, we received an complimentary Bellini in the lobby, and then once we arrived in our room there was a comp. bottle of Beringer's Chardonnay as well. I said to the bellman as he was leaving, "Are all the rooms this nice?" and his response was, "Yeah, yeah there are."
reviews.title: A Great Place to Stay

likes.disliked: — The birds outside while we ate our breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was so roomy, comfortable, and perfect. The bed had a feather bed, very nice sheets, and perfect pillows. There was a great balcony to look out over the vineyards, see the sunset or rise, and in the mornings, we got to see the hot air ballons take off.
reviews.title: Back for a 2nd time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The buffet breakfast served each morning was fantastic. They had made to order omelets, and always something different each day (ex. heuvos rancheros, breakfast burritos) in addition to the daily servings of nice cheeses, fruit, bagels, oatmeal, break pudding, fresh juices, and mimosas.
reviews.title: Restful weekend getaway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2005
reviews.text: We had a spa treatment each day in the newly renovated spa. What a slice of heaven! Be sure to get there early so you can enjoy the whole experience!
reviews.title: Love it!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, my husband and I had the best time at the Vallagio Inn. We would definitely return to stay there. There is nothing bad I can say about this place.
reviews.title: Villagio is a Good Option in Napa Valley

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Lovely room, very big with huge jacuzzi bath and a real log fire. This was needed as the weather was unseasonally cold. Yountville is a good location for wine tasting around the Napa Valley region and the advantage of staying at the Villagio is that there are lots of very good restaurants in walking distance (5-10 mins max) of the hotel. Downside was the lack of bars particularly as the hotel bar closed at 10pm which seemed a bit early. Didnt have time to use the Spa or pool but collegues tell me both were very good.
reviews.title: Great Conference Venue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The conferencing facility was very good and we were looked after very well. Excellent lunches and almost too much in the way of snacks and drinks throughout the day. Again the meeting room had a huge fireplace and the staff were happy to light the fire for us when it was cold.
reviews.title: Great spa, great location, great breakfast but hotel could be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would go again but ask for a room away from the rear of the hotel as there was a lot of traffic noise from the main road to Napa.
reviews.title: Fantastic Thanksgiving Getaway
You can probably do better
reviews.text: We stayed here for a few days post-Christmas and enjoyed it very much. The spa is fantastic and the people at the hotel are all very friendly. Breakfast is wonderful and part of the price. The only negative is that the rooms are quite dated, dark with road noise. The bathroom in particular was dark and dingy with poor water pressure. One outstanding touch was the duralog to use in the fireplace. Also the complimentary bottle of wine was very nice. You couldn't fault the location, walkable to all the good restaurants in Yountville. I would stay here again but, considering their prices, the rooms could be nicer.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent Thanksgiving 2009 in Napa Valley. We chose to stay in Yountville because of its central location and the amazing restaurants. We could not have been happier with our decision to stay there and specifically with the hotel we chose, the Villagio Inn & Spa. We got a great deal ($225 a night) and stayed for 2 nights, but wish we could have stayed longer. I understand this price is much lower than their average price, so we got an exceptional value. The breakfast alone is worth it. Complimentary coffee, mimosas, bloody marys and a wonderful spread of breads, fruit, cereral, eggs, and the most amazing bread pudding ever! They also have a made to order omelette and waffle station. We arrived early on Thanksgiving Day (about 11 am) and were able to check-in and enjoy an early lunch (the breakfast buffet is available until noon on holidays). This was perfect as most restaurants weren't open and our dinner reservation was not until 7:15 PM. We sat out on the patio in the beautiful autumn sunshine, surrounded by the vibrant fall colors of the trees of Yountville and enjoyed our first tastes of their delicous food and drink (all included in the price of the room!) Our room was spacious and clean. The amenities were nice and even included a Nespresso machine. Yum! My only complaint was there was a little bit of road noice from Highway 29 because our room was on the outer courtyard. The spa looked very nice, although we didn't have a chance to use it. We did sit in the hot tub one evening and the pool area was nice. It would be fun to stay here in the summer too! All of the greast Yountville restaurants are within walking distance as well as some cute shops. I can't wait to go back!
reviews.title: The perfect location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: don't order room service. Good to the breakfast provided. Very ice grounds and rooms. Perfect location for leaving the hotel and going to great dining or launching to the wineries. Spa could be nicer but the quality of the massage was top notch. Pool area is a little small.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed at the Villagio for a business meeting, and I was very impressed. Their service was top-notch, the food and coffee provided for the meeting was exceptional, and I loved being able to walk to one of Yountville's delicious restaurants for dinner.
reviews.title: Nice, though right off the highway
Great Hotel
reviews.text: The room was very comfortable with lots of space and all the modern conveniences (flat-panel TV, CD player with MP3 adapter).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only negative was that my little patio overlooked the parking lot and then the highway. There was constant noise from traffic well into the night.
reviews.title: Charming spot in the heart of Napa Valley

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But a bottle or two of local wine will make that all go away... I was pleased with my experience at Villagio and would go back.
reviews.title: Great value
Excellent Customer Service - Saved our Trip! Only place to stay in Napa!
reviews.text: When planning a trip to Napa, there is no other town I'd stay in other than Yountville, and there's no other property family I'd stay with than the Villagio/Vintage Inn. I was planning a surprise trip to Napa for Memorial Day weekend, and came into some complications with our itinerary. Thankfully, the great people at Villagio/Vintage Inn came to our rescue. The Managing Director and his entire team were invaluable to help plan our trip and offered up suggestions. This hotel property and the Vintage Inn have been in Yountville for years, and it is no wonder why they have maintained such a strong reputation for so long. We are absolutely excited for our trip and can't wait to come. In this day and age with hotels, it's great to see such care and concern emanating from a hotel property's management. I would trust these folks with any trip! Stay here- you will not regret it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will definitely return to Villagio.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel and spa in Yountville

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: First, the location is perfect. You are within a very short walking distance of several of the best restaurants in the wine country. Redd and Ad Hoc are across the street, and French Laundry, Bistro Jeanty and Bottego are within a block. You are also surrounded by charming tasting rooms and shops.
reviews.title: Villagio is showing it's age!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel is beautiful, quiet, and elegant. The staff is attentive. The room includes a complimentary breakfast, which is a huge spread with an omelet station, and also includes items such as a delicious quiche, chiliquilies, pastries, hot oatmeal.
reviews.title: Nice but overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Our suite was lovely with a fireplace, balcony, and huge whirlpool tub.
reviews.title: A Fabulousl Place to Relax and Enjoy Napa Valley

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Husband's conference was held at the Villagio. What a beautiful place for a business gathering and a leisure trip. The staff was extremely helpful upon our early arrival and helped us with our business needs prior to our check in. Our room was huge! big comfy bed, sitting area, real fire place, dressing area, big tub. Welcome bottle of wine, and welcome cocktail in the lobby too. We had the hotel breakfast on our last morning, as the conference included meals, and it was very very good. Our meals were all catered by the hotel and they were wonderful. One of the meals was catered off site at the Tamber Bey Vineyard and it was spectacular.
reviews.title: Relax at the Villagio

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a charming spot, and you are right in a little village so there is shopping and dining. The spa is very nice. I booked a facial and I used the spa before hand. Really enjoyed it! Wonderful staff!
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010
reviews.text: The hotel is right near CA 29, and as other reviewers have mentioned, the rooms that border the highway have road noise. We were on that side, but I normally sleep with earplugs (learned that from traveling) and I slept just fine. I liked the location because it was easy to get to the wineries and vineyards. I liked the self parking - I like to be able to get to my car and go!
reviews.title: Waht a great spot for a getaway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Villagio did a superb job of making the conference so intimate and special.
reviews.title: The Villagio is truly a gem in Yountville

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: My husband and I traveled to Napa Valley on route to Lake Tahoe. We stopped at the visitor center in Napa Valley and they suggested we stay at the Villagio. What a great suggestion. The hotel is beautiful and the staff are wonderful. The moment we stepped in the the lobby we were treated like royalty. We were offered cocktails and the tea service was great. The room was large and the tub wonderful. Breakfast is a full breakfast with omlets, oatmeal, cereals, fruit and more. Anything we asked for was delivered in minutes and the staff will go above and beyond. Our room had a small patio which overlooked the vineyard which was great for sitting outside and reading. The room was extremely clean and the tub is hugh. You will not be disappointed at the Villagio.
reviews.title: superb all the way down to the details

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I'll start off with a word re other recent reviews: There is no longer any construction at this hotel. In fact, I have seldom stayed in a quieter hotel. We had two adjoining rooms: a pleasant suite and a normal room. Both were well appointed, clean, and no smell of smoke anywhere, including the towels. (My pet peeve is a smoky hotel towel.)
reviews.title: Sweet retreat in the heart of wine country
great location in wine country
reviews.text: The check-in was pleasant and efficient. We were led to the room by a very nice staff member, possibly because the layout of the buildings calls for this when you first arrive. The layout is a series of two-story buildings, mostly, in my view, 2 rooms up and 2 rooms down. There is a slight Tuscan feel to the place. It has immaculately manicured grounds with lush vegetation and water features separating the buildings.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The size of the suite is possibly a little small for the price, but you will get a separate seating room, which, by the way, seemed fairly useless unless you want your children to have a separate little play area. There is a pleasant but tiny patio, a nice size closet and a fine bathroom.
reviews.title: Losing a little luster

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The size of the normal room was fine and it had the same size (tiny) patio where you could sit and read or enjoy the lemon trees just outside. The rooms are rather dark in the daytime, but that helps with feeling cooler on a hot day. But you won't want to spend a lot of daytime hours in your room while in Napa Valley, I hope!
reviews.title: Anniversary in Napa

likes.liked: — Service was terrible and hotel was not that clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beds were very comfortable, bathtubs were new in appearance, and the room furnishings were fine. There was a normal-sized flat screen TV on the wall opposite the beds in each room. Nothing was rundown in any way.
reviews.title: My Napa Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I booked a last minute trip to Napa and found a $199 rate. The place is simply amazing. The is no better place to stay than this one. If you want to be close to all the winerys and the best restaurants, this hotel rocks. The people were kind and very easy to work with. Honestly, I have nothing bad to say at all. One of the best things is the breakfast. The chef makes a full buffett breakfast which is included in any room you get. Just find the cheapest room and the breakfast is included... even if they say it's not. It;s not just a piece of toast either. It's a full spread with an omlette bar. Truly amazing. we are coming back again and again.
reviews.title: This is the only place to stay in Napa
Relaxing place, friendly staff
reviews.text: Warm friendly place. Staff is very helpful with kids and recommendations for things to do in the area. Great spa and setting.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: we got a fantastic rate $159! of course it is rainy cold March, and a weekday....but the perfect spot for a girlfriends get away or couples retreat. the grounds are lovely. the lobbey is warm and welcoming, with a large fireplace and lots of cozy seating. beautiful patio and pool. breakfast is included and it is outstanding - huge selection of delicious and very fresh pastries, bagels, oatmeal, delicious breakfast burritos, potatoes, cheese, made to order omlets, fruit, juices, champagne - you name it!!! wish we would have been back from the wineries in time to check out the afternoon reception. Rooms are very nice, though not quite as luxorious as the rest of the resort. There is a lovely pation off each room, and they give you a bottle of wine! A bit dark, but with fireplace. Mattresses was OK, not bad, but not top notch. It is firm, which I like, and I am pretty picky. Sheets are good. Had 2 for 1 treatsment special at the Spa which were wonderful! Can walk to many of the fabulous restaurants nearby. Bottege was outstanding!!! I would definately come back!!
reviews.title: Lovely spot, great location, very nice spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: We have had a conference here every year for many years (since before I worked for my company - at least six years), and this place just gets better and better. The space you get in your hotel room for the money is incredible, and the rooms themselves are lovely. Fireplaces, coffee makers, and tons and tones of room.
reviews.title: Gets better and better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The breakfasts are lovely - some of my colleagues say they are not as good as "in the old days", but I can't see what one can possibly miss - fresh omelets cooked to order, many different types of bread and pastries, fresh fruit, fabulous potatoes and - for those who don't have 18 hours work ahead of them that day - Cuvee Napa for a glass of fizz to start the day!
reviews.title: Great for Group Celebration

description: Villagio Inn & Spa named to Travel+Leisure Magazine's 2012 "500 Best Hotels in the World", as well as T+L's 2011 Top 50 Hotels in the United States. An AAA Four Diamond Award Property, it blends the active, contemporary flavors of California's Napa Valley wine country with the warmth and charm of a countryside village in Tuscany. Villagio's 112 guest rooms, Spa Villagio and executive conference center are situated in a lush garden setting and just walking distance to the Town of Yountville's michelin star restaurants and celebrity chefs. Every guest room features oversize sunken bathtub, fireplace, robes, a complimentary bottle of wine upon check-in, flat screen television and in-room coffee and tea. A daily champagne breakfast buffet and afternoon tea service is included with every stay. Villagio Inn & Spa has recently been recognized as a winner of TripAdvisor's 2012 Certificate of Excellence award.
